snippet: A tentative settlement was reached in a class-action lawsuit singling out five Social Security administrative law judges with particularly high denial rates.
abstract: Settlement is proposed in class-action lawsuit accusing five Social Security Administration judges in Queens, responsible for reviewing claims for disability benefits, of trivializing applicants' physical conditions and subjecting them to harsh questioning; thousands of poor Queens residents with debilitating conditions who were denied federal disability benefits would have their cases reconsidered under agreement.
lead_paragraph: A tentative settlement was reached in a class-action lawsuit singling out five Social Security administrative law judges with particularly high denial rates.

headline.seo: Rejected Disability Claims in Queens May Be Reheard
headline.main: Rejected Disability Claims in Queens May Be Reheard
headline.print_headline: Rejected Disability Claims In Queens May Be Reheard
